bibl.title: Petitioner v. Defendant. Type of document
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

body.div1:
IN THE CIRCUIT COURT OF THE UNITED STATES, DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
IN THE MATTER OF THE APPLICATION OF ADOLPH KRUG FOR WRIT OF HABEAS CORPUS AND RELEASE, and other proceedings thereon.
NOTICE OF APPEAL.
To the State of Washington, and to Hon. W. H. Moyer, Sheriff of King County, State of Washington, and to Hon. Jas. F. McElroy, Prosecuting Attorney for King County, State of Washington.
Comes now the Petitioner, Adolph Krug, and appeals the above entiteld cause and the whole thereof to the Supreme Court of the United States, holding terms at the City of Washington, District of Columbia, and to the next regular term thereof, and more especially appeals from that certain order made and entered in the above entitled cause on the 8th day of March A.D. 1897, by the Honorable C.H. Hanford, Judge, sitting as the Circuit Court, denying the Peition of Petitioner for a Writ of Habeas Corpus and refusing to grant the said Writ of Habeas Corpus as in his said Petition prayed.
And you will please take notice that the record and proceedings upon the said Petition will be duly certified through the said above entitled Court to the said Supreme Court of the United States at the next regular term thereof upon said above named appeal.
JA Strattion, L. C. Gilman J HenryHemming Of Counsel.
Jas Hamilton Lewis Attorney for Petitioner.
Tx
No 599
In the Circuit Court OF THE UNITED STATES, FOR THE DISTRICT OF WASHINGTON, NORTHERN DIVISION.
In re Application of Adolph Drug for a Writ of Habeas Corpus etc.,
Notice of Appeal.
Jas Hamilton Lewis Stratton, Lewis & Gilman Attorney for Petitioner, 101-106 OCCIDENTAL, BLOCK, SEATTLE.
Copy of within notice of appeal received and due service of the same acknowledged this 11" day of March 1897
Jas H Maklroy Prosecuting Attorney for King County Wm H. Moy - Sheriff
FILED Mar 11 1897 IN THE U.S. CIRCUIT COURT A. REEVES AYRES. CLERK
By H M Walther DEPUTY
